title: Comprehensive oral examination
notes: # A comprehensive evaluation and recording of the current status of the dentition, mouth and associated structures performed on a patient. This applies to new patients, established patients who have had a significant change in health conditions, or established patients who have been absent from active treatment for two or more years. This may require interpretation of information acquired through additional diagnostic procedures reported and itemised separately. This evaluation includes recording an appropriate oral and medical history and any other relevant information.

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): #. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Periodic oral examination
notes: An evaluation of the dentition, mouth and associated structures performed on a patient of record to determine any changes in the patient’s oral and medical health status since a previous comprehensive or periodic examination. This may require interpretation of information acquired through additional diagnostic procedures reported and itemised separately.

title: Oral examination – limited
notes: A limited evaluation of the dentition, mouth and associated structures performed on a patient. This may be for a specific oral health problem or complaint. This may require interpretation of information acquired through additional diagnostic procedures reported and itemised separately. This evaluation includes recording an appropriate oral and medical history and any other relevant information.

title: Consultation
notes: # A consultation to seek advice or discuss treatment options regarding a specific dental or oral condition. This consultation includes recording an appropriate medical history and any other relevant information.

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): #. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Consultation – extended (30 minutes or more)
notes: # An extended consultation to seek advice or discuss treatment options regarding a specific dental or oral complaint. This consultation includes recording an appropriate medical history and any other relevant information.

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): #. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Consultation by referral
notes: # A consultation with a patient referred by a dental or medical practitioner for an opinion or management of a specific dental disorder. The consultation may not necessarily be with a specialist. The referring practitioner should be provided with a report from the consultant, included within the item number.

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): #. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Consultation by referral – extended (30 minutes or more)
notes: # An extended consultation with a patient referred by a dental or medical practitioner for an opinion or management of a specific dental disorder. The consultation may not necessarily be with a specialist. The referring practitioner should be provided with a report from the consultant, included within the item number.

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): #. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Written report (not elsewhere included)
notes: T A written report not addressed to a referring practitioner involved in the patient’s care.

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): T. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Referral
notes: # The preparation of correspondence referring a patient to another practitioner and providing appropriate information.

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): #. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Intraoral radiograph – per exposure
notes: # Taking and interpreting an intraoral radiograph.

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): #. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Cone Beam Computed Tomography – scan acquisition – per appointment
notes: # Acquisition of a Cone Beam Computed Tomography (CBCT) scan and the associated images. Reconstructed images from this scan are included in this item number. For interpretation and/or analysis, see items 087, 088, 089, 090, 091. CBCT is also referred to as 'CBVT'.

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): #. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Extraoral radiograph – maxillary, mandibular – per exposure
notes: # Taking and interpreting a radiograph of the upper and/or lower jaw using a film placed outside the mouth – for example, oblique lateral radiograph. Diagnostic Services Diagnostic Services

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): #. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Lateral, antero-posterior, postero-anterior or submento-vertex radiograph of the skull
notes: per exposure # Taking and interpreting an extraoral radiograph of the head taken from the lateral, antero-posterior, postero- anterior or submento-vertex of the skull. No cephalostat is used.

title: Radiograph of temporomandibular joint – per exposure
notes: # Taking and interpreting a radiograph of the temporomandibular joint.

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): #. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Cephalometric radiograph – lateral, antero-posterior, postero-anterior or submento-vertex
notes: per exposure # Taking and interpreting a radiograph of the head taken from the side, the front or the back or through the vertex of the skull for the purpose of measurement and analysis. A cephalostat is used to standardise the conditions of imaging.

title: Panoramic radiograph – per exposure
notes: # Taking and interpreting an extraoral radiograph presenting a panoramic view of part or all of the mandible and/or maxilla and/or adjacent structures.

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): #. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Hand-wrist radiograph for skeletal age assessment
notes: # Taking and interpreting a radiograph of the wrist bones, used to assess the degree of skeletal development and maturity.

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): #. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Computed tomography of the skull or parts thereof
notes: # A radiograph is made of a region using tomographic X-ray equipment that may produce a series of diagnostic images. A cephalostat may be used to standardise the conditions of imaging (for interpretation and/or analysis, see 083). This procedure describes multiple images and should be itemised once only per CT scan.

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): #. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Bacteriological examination
notes: An examination for bacteria or other microorganisms in samples obtained from the patient.

title: Culture examination and identification
notes: A sample is taken from oral material and is cultured for examination and identification of the microorganisms present.

title: Antibiotic sensitivity test
notes: A laboratory procedure where a live culture of a suspected pathogen is challenged with antibiotic samples to determine the sensitivity or resistance of the microorganisms to the antibiotics tested.

title: Collection of specimen for pathology examination
notes: The non-surgical collection and preparation for transport of a specimen for examination at a pathology laboratory.

title: Saliva screening test
notes: Testing a saliva sample to assess its physiological properties.

title: Microbiological screening test
notes: Microbiological assessment of a sample.

title: Biopsy of tissue
notes: A surgical procedure to obtain a sample of tissue for pathological examination.

title: Histopathological examination of tissue
notes: A histopathological examination to determine the disease status of a section of tissue.

title: Cytological investigation
notes: A microscopic examination of cells obtained from a smear or in situ staining of a suspected lesion to determine any aberrant characteristics that may suggest that the lesion is malignant or related to some other condition.

title: Blood collection
notes: The collection of blood for diagnostic and/or treatment purposes.

title: Haematological examination
notes: The haematological examination of a blood sample.

title: Procedures to derive biologically active components from a collection of blood
notes: Deriving biologically active components for patient treatment by processing blood collected from the patient.

title: Comprehensive head and neck cancer examination and risk assessment
notes: A specific comprehensive examination that consists of visual inspection and manual palpation of extraoral head and neck structures and intraoral soft tissues, and may involve indirect laryngoscopy or fibre-optic pharyngolaryngoscopy. This includes a detailed patient risk assessment.

title: Pulp testing – per appointment
notes: A non-invasive test used to determine the clinical status of the pulp. It involves the application of external stimulation to the pulp to determine its response. Other teeth are generally tested for comparison. This procedure should be itemised only once for each appointment when pulp testing is performed.

title: Diagnostic model – per model
notes: # The production of a physical model from an impression or digital data. The model is used for examination and treatment planning procedures. This item is not to be used to describe a working model.

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): #. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Photographic records – intraoral – per appointment
notes: # Photographic images inside the mouth.

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): #. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Photographic records – extraoral – per appointment
notes: # Photographic images showing the face or a region of the head and neck outside the mouth.

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): #. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Diagnostic modelling – physical – per tooth
notes: # Physical modelling (e.g. using wax or other material) to facilitate the development of treatment plan.

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): #. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Diagnostic modelling – digital – per tooth
notes: # Digital modelling to facilitate the development of treatment plan.

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): #. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Intraoral evaluation of diagnostic modelling – per tooth or tooth replacement
notes: # A procedure utilising data from 074 or 075 to create an intraoral simulation of proposed treatment to evaluate function, aesthetics and other characteristics.

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): #. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Cephalometric analysis – excluding radiographs
notes: # The analysis of a cephalometric radiograph (item 036) by measurement of specific biological landmarks in order to determine and predict patterns of development of the cranio-maxillofacial growth complex. The procedure is often employed in orthodontic diagnosis.

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): #. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Tooth-jaw size prediction analysis
notes: # The analysis of records, including radiographs and casts, to predict the relationship between the anticipated size of the mandible, the maxilla and the teeth that these bones have to accommodate.

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): #. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Tomographic analysis
notes: # The analysis of a tomograph (item 039) by measurement of specific biological landmarks. The procedure is often employed in treatment planning for implant and other surgical procedures.

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): #. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Cone Beam Computed Tomography analysis and/or interpretation – small field of view
notes: (less than one complete dental arch) # The analysis and/or interpretation of a cone beam computed scan (refer to item 026) with a limited field of view. The procedure is often employed in diagnosis, treatment planning and analysis for dental procedures. CBCT is also referred to as 'CBVT'.

title: Cone Beam Computed Tomography analysis and/or interpretation – maxillary or mandibular
notes: dentition (single arch) # The analysis and/or interpretation of a cone beam computed scan (refer to item 026) of the maxillary or mandibular dentition and supporting alveolar structures. The procedure is often employed in diagnosis, treatment planning and analysis for dental procedures. CBCT is also referred to as 'CBVT'. Diagnostic Services Diagnostic Services

title: Cone Beam Computed Tomography analysis and/or interpretation – maxillary and mandibular
notes: dentition (both arches) # The analysis and/or interpretation of a cone beam computed scan (refer to item 026) of the maxillary and mandibular dentition and supporting alveolar structures. The procedure is often employed in diagnosis, treatment planning and analysis for dental procedures. CBCT is also referred to as 'CBVT'.

title: Cone Beam Computed Tomography analysis and/or interpretation
notes: temporomandibular joints only # The analysis and/or interpretation of a cone beam computed scan (refer to item 026) of the temporomandibular joints only, including an open mouth scan if required. The procedure is often employed in diagnosis, treatment planning and analysis for dental procedures. CBCT is also referred to as 'CBVT'.

title: Cone Beam Computed Tomography analysis and/or interpretation – orofacial structures
notes: # The analysis and/or interpretation of a cone beam computed scan (refer to item 026) of the entire dentition and supporting alveolar structures, also including any or all of the following: temporomandibular joints, paranasal sinuses and airway, cranial base, cervical spine. The procedure is often employed in diagnosis, treatment planning and analysis for dental procedures. CBCT is also referred to as 'CBVT'.

warnings.title: Schedule notes apply
warnings.text: Marked with symbol(s): #. Check the official schedule notes for restrictions/eligibility.

title: Removal of plaque and/or stain
notes: # Removal of dental plaque and/or stain from the surfaces of all teeth and/or implants. This item is included in procedures described by items 114, 115, 250 and 251.

notes: The reshaping and polishing of pre-existing restorations.

notes: Removal of calculus from the surfaces of teeth and/or implants.

notes: This item describes procedures in item 114 when, because of the extent or degree of calculus, an additional appointment(s) is required to remove deposits from the teeth and/or implants.
